title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 11, ch. III, subch. A, pt. 50 - Separate Accounts and Separate Account Contracts
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 11, ch. III, subch. A, pt. 50 - Separate Accounts and Separate Account Contracts

State Regulations
§ 50.1 - Definitions
§ 50.2 - Qualification of insurance companies to issue separate account annuity contracts
§ 50.3 - Separate accounts
§ 50.4 - Insurer contributions to separate accounts
§ 50.5 - Filing and approval of contracts
§ 50.6 - Variable annuity contracts
§ 50.7 - Standard provisions in separate account annuity contracts
§ 50.8 - Illustrations of benefits payable under separate account annuity contracts
§ 50.9 - Required reports
§ 50.10 - Authorized foreign and alien insurance companies
§ 50.11 - Separability clause
§ 50.12 - [Repealed]
Subpart 50-1 - Separate Accounts and Separate Account Contracts Prior to January 1, 2023 (§ 50-1.0 to 50-1.11)

Subpart 50-2 - Separate Accounts and Separate Account Contracts on or after January 1, 2023 (§ 50-2.1 to 50-2.14)

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 11, ch. III, subch. A, pt. 50

Statutory authority: Insurance Law, §§201, 301, 4240

The
amended version of this part by

New

York State Register August 31, 2022/Volume XLIV, Issue 35, eff. 8/31/2022

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
